title: The Verb Engine: Action
description: Systematic verb paradigm training. Five high-frequency action verbs across all tenses, wrapped in scenarios.

episodes.intro: The verb you hear most in any conversation ABOUT conversations. I'm speaking. I spoke. I will speak. Speak!
episodes.scenario: 'Who are you talking to?'. 'I was speaking to Anna'. 'Don't speak so loudly'. 'Speak in Tamil'. 'I will speak to him tomorrow'. Every form in a family argument.

episodes.intro: The market verb. You need it every single day. What did you buy? What should I buy? Buy this!
episodes.scenario: 'What are you buying?'. 'I bought vegetables'. 'Buy two kilos of rice'. 'I will buy milk tomorrow'. The daily shopping conversation.

episodes.intro: You lose things. Everyone loses things. The verb for searching is your daily companion.
episodes.scenario: 'I'm searching for my keys'. 'I searched everywhere'. 'Search under the sofa'. 'I'll search in the car'. The daily hunt for lost objects.

episodes.intro: Movement at two speeds. The physical action verbs. Walk slowly. Run fast. Don't run in the house!
episodes.scenario: 'Walk slowly'. 'I walked to the shop yesterday'. 'The bus is coming — run!'. 'Don't run in the house!'. 'He ran very fast'. Two verbs, two speeds, all tenses.

episodes.topic: BOSS FIGHT: The Full Day in Verbs
episodes.intro: Narrate a complete day using all verb families from this level and previous levels.
episodes.scenario: Morning: I spoke to wife. I walked to the bus stop. I ran because the bus came. Afternoon: I searched for the file. I bought lunch. Evening: Speaking to friend. Walking home. Full paradigm usage.

episodes.intro: Audit Day. All verb paradigms from this level.
episodes.scenario: Rapid fire. I say the English tense, you give the Tamil conjugation. Present. Past. Future. Command.

episodes.intro: The secret pattern. Add the infinitive to Venum, Mudiyum, or Kudaadhu and you can express any desire, ability, or prohibition.
episodes.scenario: Combining verbs. 'I need to go'. 'I can't eat now'. 'You shouldn't speak loudly'. 'I'm going to buy vegetables'. The infinitive is the key that chains all verbs together.
